name: chicken pot pie
ingredients: 1 box Pillsbury Pastry Pie Shell Crust (or make your own)
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Heat butter or margarine over low heat until melted. Add the onion, salt and pepper. Cook until onions are clear. Blend in the flour and stir until thick and bubbly. Add about 1/2 cup of the broth and milk at a time, stirring constantly. Heat until boiling, cook for 1 minute. Turn heat down and add the chicken (or turkey) and vegetables. Pour into a pie plate lined with an unbaked pie shell crust. Top with the second crust. Slash a few vent holes in the top, be creative. Bake at 425 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Enjoy!

name: chicken parmigiana
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine breadcrumbs, salt, pepper and parmesan cheese. Dip chicken in beaten egg, then in crumb mixture. Brown in 1/4 cup oil. Pour spaghetti sauce into the bottom of a 9"x13" baking dish. Arrange browned chicken pieces over sauce. Cover with foil and bake 40 minutes. Remove foil and top chicken with mozzarella cheese. Bake 15 minutes uncovered. Serve with pasta.

name: agnello al forno (lamb)
ingredients: 3-4 red bell peppers, cut into 1/2" dice
5 scallions, thinly sliced, white and green separated
3/4 tsp finely chopped fresh marjoram (or 1/2 tsp dried)
directions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Brush lamb with 2 tbsp olive oil and heavily season with kosher salt and fresh cracked pepper. Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Add lamb racks, fat side down, brown on all sides (6 minutes). Transfer to a roasting pan. Reserve skillet with pan juices. Roast lamb until thermometer inserted into thickest part and not touching bone registers 125-130 degrees for medium rare (15-20 minutes). Add 1 tbsp olive oil to the reserved skillet, heat over medium-high heat. Add peppers and white scallions. Season with salt and pepper. Saute 2 minutes. Add broth, gently simmer on medium-low heat. Cook until tender (8 minutes). Remove from heat, stir in scallion greens and marjoram. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer lamb to cutting board and let rest for 10 minutes. Cut into chops and serve with the vegetables. Enjoy!

name: tacos in pasta shells
ingredients: 1 cup (4 oz) shredded monterey jack cheese
Garnish with lettuce, tomato and olives
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook beef in skillet over medium-high heat. Separate meat and drain. Reduce heat to medium low and add cream cheese, salt, chili powder and simmer 5 minutes. Toss pasta shells with butter, fill with beef mixture. Arrange shells in a 9"x13" buttered baking dish. Pour taco sauce over each shell. Cover with foil and bake 15 minutes. Uncover and top with cheeses and crushed chips. Bake 15 more minutes until bubbly. Top with source cream, onions and garnish. Enjoy!

name: lemon coconut piña colada
ingredients: 1/2 cup canned sweetened cream of coconut (CoCo Lopez)
directions: Place first six ingredients in a large blender. Add ice. Cover and blend until smooth. Pour into two 14 oz poco grande glasses. Garnish with grated lemon peel and nutmeg. Cheers!

name: key lime pie
directions: Shake in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into martini glass. Serve with a twist of lime.

name: cosmopolitan
directions: Place ice in cocktail shaker, add all ingredients. Shake until well blended. Pour in a martini glass and garnish with a twist of lime. Enjoy!

name: hot artichoke dip
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups very thinly sliced leeks (sliced lengthwise)
baguette thinly sliced on the diagonal or crackers
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray an 11"x7" dish with cooking spray. In a bowl, combine artichokes, cheese, mayonnaise, sour cream, 1/2 cup parmesan, salt and pepper, and hot sauce. Stir well. Spoon into baking dish and sprinkle with remaining parmesan cheese. Bake until bubbly, 25-30 minutes. In a small skillet, fry leeks in oil, stirring constantly until crisp (5 minutes). Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt if desired. Top the dip with leeks before serving. Serve hot with toasted baguette or crackers. Enjoy!

name: stuffed medjool dates
ingredients: 1 chorizo spanish sausage for filling (substitute your favorite cheese, meats, olives, etc.
directions: Pit dates by creating a small slit in the side of the date. Replace pit with a piece of chorizo. Close date around chorizo by gently pinching seam together. Wrap each date in bacon. Broil for 2-3 minutes or until bacon is cooked to your liking.

name: chocolate chip cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Remember to have all ingredients at room temperature and, most importantly, do not overmix! Mix the first 6 ingredients until smooth, then add the dry ingredients until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Place onto ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes. Cool on brown paper or cooling rack. Enjoy!
